page.title: 12The Countess Wear Area
page.content:
Countess Wear lies about 3 miles south of Exeter city centre. It is a residential suburb. A few houses on Topsham Road and Glasshouse Lane were built before 1945 but most have been built in the 1950's as a planned council estate.
The estate is well layed out and planned. It is built of a fairly low density and it has many grassed areas for recreation and amenity. There is good service provision in the area. A small shopping precinct, a primary and middle school form a focal point for the estate. The 100 Club which is a youth club on the estate is very popular with the youngsters both in the evenings and during the school holidays. There is a clinic and a church which has a church hall for gatherings.
